entry.title: Significance of Architecture
entry.content: When interviewing new candidates for the software architect position, I like to start with a few awkward questions, such as “What is architecture?”, “Who is an architect?” and “What do you do?”, before waiting for the ensuing moment of disbelief and long silence. Maybe some of them will try to...

entry.title: When does AI take my job?

entry.title: Make Internet Great Again
entry.content: I think we’re at a turning point in the history of our civilisation. We’ve all thought stability was the way to go, but it feels like things are changing more quickly than ever before, at least in our lifetime. It’s a shame, but it looks like the internet, one of...

entry.title: Power supply for bare ESP 8266 units
entry.content: For battery powered ESP 8266 projects we would like to have a full control over electrical components that we use on board. This is because everything that draws power will also drain our battery, and this is something we want to avoid. The Wemos D1 Mini module seems to...

entry.title: Gradle Retro Assembler plugin is released
entry.content: The idea of a tool that can automatically download all dependencies and build my 6502 projects arose some time ago. In the meantime I started using 64spec for testing my assembly code. The library itself is great but requires a lot of manual operations once a great number...

entry.title: Weather Station with ESP 8266 (part 1)
entry.content: The ESP 8266 has relatively high power consumption (around 70-80mA) which makes battery powered devices difficult to build, unless we accept a very short battery lifetime. Reasons for this are apparently connected with WiFi communication model, which is not especially economical, big processing power of the ESP chip itself has...

entry.title: Internet of Things done cheaply with ESP 8266
entry.content: For some time I had an idea to do few “home improvements” and, as a side effect, learn a bit about microcontrollers and electronics. So called “smart home” can be expensive - there are a lot of out-of-the-box solutions that cost a small fortune (as I said: “for some time”,...

entry.title: Put subroutine into the library
entry.content: Subroutine is an essential concept in programming. Advantages of using subroutines are quite clear - instead of doing a repetitive work, we define chunk of code once and “jump” to it any time we need it. It is a part of DRY principle (do not repeat yourself), which allows to...

entry.title: Writing and using libraries in KickAssembler
entry.content: It’s a long way I took from early times when I coded something for MOS 65XX family to now, when I actually code for money. entry.title: Review: New PSU for Commodore 64/128
entry.content: Reliability of original C64 CPU has been disputed in community for long time. Commodore had problems with it in the past, plenty of houses were put on fire.
